intro: Guatteria asterantha, commonly known as the star-flowered guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are edible berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Guatteria asterantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
